definitions.definition: to (cause something to) change from being open to not being open:
examples: Could you close the door/window please?

definitions.definition: When a shop, restaurant, or public place closes, people cannot go into it:
examples: The banks had closed (to customers) so I couldn't get any money out.

definitions.definition: the end of something, or the time when you end it:
examples: I tried to bring the conversation to a close.

definitions.definition: having direct family connections or shared beliefs, support, and sympathy:
examples: There weren't many people at the funeral - just close family/relatives.

definitions.definition: People who are close know each other very well and like each other a lot, or who see and talk to each other a lot:
examples: Mira is one of my closest friends.

definitions.definition: not far in position or time:
examples: Don't get too close to that dog, Rosie.
Shall we call in on Miranda? You know she lives quite close by.
